Articles.Content: Well I have to admit their way is more realistic. And i wouldn't have changed anything if they had a fixed value. Like you get 50% the first time and then another 50% the second time.
Thanx a bunch for this mod. Finally something from stopping my addiction to complete everything

> 
> Thanx a bunch for this mod. Finally something from stopping my addiction to complete everything

Thats the main reason i came up with this idea^^ i wanted the full 100%
This mod is pretty sweet. Makes gathering science feel more rewarding and less tedious.

If you are interested in making further changes (to xmitDataScalar parameters, so that any experiment result that requires no physical deliverance of samples is 100% transmittable), I can provide you with config I was using for myself since 0.25. It covers most known science mods.
@Dr. Jet Maybe someone would like to have that feature, but i thought that would be a bit cheaty.

It looks like this mod diapered from CKAN. All maculator's mods did.

Edit: they are there, changing filter option is enough. Somebody (author?) change its status to "incompatible".

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-10T23:16:28Z" title="11/10/2015 11:16  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 10, 2015</time> by bartekltg**
Or KSP 1.0.5 got out ? CKAN is not magic and if a mod is set as compatible with 1.0.4 it will not decide by itself that it will work on 1.0.5

Yes, we know. It is more complex. Many mods has "Max KSP version" 1.0.4 and are 'compatible' according to CKAN.

Edit: At first I did not recognize you. Your mods are great!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-11T03:58:13Z" title="11/11/2015 03:58  AM" data-short="8 yr">November 11, 2015</time> by bartekltg**
Chiming in to say I too am hoping to see this updated in CKAN soon.

Same here, please get this updated!

Thanks

But is it working or will it break the game? It is in fact incompatible or it's just ckan that can't see it properly?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-09T07:30:58Z" title="12/09/2015 07:30  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 9, 2015</time> by Aspira**
It works fine, just needs to be installed manually.

Great News.

Thank you.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-09T11:13:16Z" title="12/09/2015 11:13  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 9, 2015</time> by Aspira**
Should be in CKAN for 1.0.5 soon.
Thanks to whoever got it marked as compatible. It is so tiny it will never ever get a conflict wich anyother mod. I was busy and forgot about ksp and my mods. Sorry

Updated the mod:

-added partdescriptions

-moved it to spaceport.info

-renamed it to "Science - Full reward!"

-added a line in the .cfg wich, if enabled, unlocks the exeriments at the "start" node of the tree. For those who start the game the 100. time and want to progress faster.

Just open "Science-Full-reward.cfg" in any texteditor and remove the "//" from this line and save:

    //%TechRequired = start

-ckan is on the way

**Edited <time datetime="2016-02-17T12:45:33Z" title="02/17/2016 12:45  PM" data-short="8 yr">February 17, 2016</time> by maculator**

First off, let me thank you for an excellent, straightforward mod; I do not miss having to repeat experiments mindlessly.

That said, is there a way to remove the blurb text that the recent version of the mod added to all science parts (the text which reminds the player that you don't need to repeat science)? I find it rather unappealing, especially since it's added categorically to all parts in the science category - which includes antennae, scanning equipment, and even the KER modules.

Edit: Nevermind, I figured it out. It was a simple change, I see.

Ups. Didn't notice it gets added to all parts. When I'm done fooling around with 1.1 I'll fix that.
1.1 Compatible ?

It's not working for me (1.1.1180)

I don't know why but I'm open for suggestions to fix it. I need this mod ... like ... soooooooo much. I can't do "do every experiment multiple times" anymore since i first used "no more science grinding" for the first time. You got me addicted and now you have to get me my fix!!  DO IT !!!

But seriously, a new game is horrible once you are used to this mod. So please fix it as soon as possible ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 23 hours ago, k0spwn said:
> 
> 
> 1.1 Compatible ?
> 

Yep.  Just be sure to use the updated ModuleManager [[link](https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/ModuleManager/)].

Did you get the 1.1 compatible version of ModuleManager? This mod is just a config for that, you'll need to grab version 2.6.21 from [here](https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/ModuleManager/).

Seems to work somewhat good on KSP 1.1 .. but is it just me or does the Science Junior not give the full science value?
